title: ESA Prepares To DeOrbit Aeolus Spacecraft
summary: The European Space Agency (ESA) is preparing for the assisted re-entry of the Aeolus spacecraft. This decision comes after the highly successful mission, which saw Aeolus making groundbreaking contributions to Earth's weather and climate monitoring.

title: Telesat To Restart LEO Satellite Demo Thanks To RocketLab Launch
summary: RocketLab successfully launched a payload for Telesat, allowing the Canadian satellite operator to restart its low Earth orbit (LEO) demonstrations.

title: NASA plans for lunar fission power systems face fiscal challenges
summary: Advocates of nuclear power systems for lunar exploration are calling on NASA to find ways to continue development amid fiscal challenges and competing priorities.

title: Space Force To Add Third NSSL Lane 2 Provider, But Limited to 7 Launches
summary: The U.S. Space Force’s Space Systems Command is modifying its procurement of future National Security Space Launch providers. Now three instead of two companies will be able to win contracts […]

title: ESA preparing for “assisted reentry” of Aeolus spacecraft
summary: The European Space Agency is in the final stages of performing an “assisted reentry” of an Earth science spacecraft, an effort that will attempt to bring the satellite down over the ocean in a little more than a week.
